intro: Silene arvatica var. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. This variant is distinguished by its intermediate characteristics between the typical varietal forms of Silene arvatica.
